title: Inside knowledge on England: South Africa's Saracens contingent confident they know how to disrupt gameplans
text:
Vincent Koch says South Africa’s intimate knowledge of Saracens’ systems and gameplans, accrued over many years of playing in the Premiership, will help them to “manage” England in Saturday’s World Cup final.

The Premiership champions’ fingerprints are all over Eddie Jones' England. Saracens have a total of nine players in the 31-man squad, with six of them likely to start on Saturday.

“There are quite a lot of Saracens players in their team,” Koch said on Wednesday. “When we look at them we can see a lot of similarities [between how England and Saracens play].

“The thing is, our focus is mainly on us. We know what they are going to bring....
description: Vincent Koch says South Africa’s intimate knowledge of Saracens’ systems and gameplans, accrued over many years of playing in the Premiership, will help them to “manage” England in Saturday’s World Cup final.
